wikipedia_page.main: Ron Marchant CB was chief executive of the UK Patent Office, now known as the UK Intellectual Property Office, until 30 March 2007, when he retired.  He currently works at the World Intellectual Property Organization.

response: The IPO is led by the Comptroller General of Patents, Designs and Trade Marks, who is also Registrar of Trade Marks,Section 62 of the Trade Marks Act 1994 Registrar of DesignsSection 44(1) of the Registered Designs Act 1949 and Chief Executive of the IPO. Since 1 May 2017, the Comptroller has been Tim Moss,Tim Moss, Chief Executive and Comptroller General, Intellectual Property Office web site. Consulted on 10 August 2017. following the resignation of John AltyJohn Alty, Director General, Trade Policy who had been Comptroller General since 2010. The Comptroller General before Alty was Ian Fletcher, who had taken over after the retirement of Ron Marchant on 30 March 2007.Patent Office press release , 20 March 2007 The previous Comptroller General was Alison Brimelow (who was afterwards President of the European Patent Office).
